main event: A fiery object, believed to be a meteor, blazed across the Florida sky on 5 June 1949, observed by many from Tampa to St. Simon's Island, Georgia.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 40 minutes with a visible trail stretching approximately 800 miles., Witnesses described the object as emitting a long, luminous tail and making a 'Z' shape in the sky., Military personnel from MacDill Air Force Base disagreed with the official meteor classification based on their observations., Reports indicated the object was too large to be a guided missile or aircraft., Captains from the local Air Force stated the object was traveling above the speed of sound and eventually faded from view.
sighted object: A fiery object with a long smoke or vapor trail
witness description: Aircrew members of the 307th Bombardment Group
